p: The intergenerational dimension of climate justice has long been acknowledged in theory and in rhetoric but has arguably become politically salient only in the last few years. The transnational movement of climate ‘school strikes’ has clearly had an impact on policy, at least in the EU. European Commission Executive Vice-President for the European Green Deal (EGD) Frans Timmermans has stated that ‘[t]he fact that we put sustainability and the climate crisis front and centre [of the Social Democrats’ 2019 European Parliament campaign] is to a large extent the result of our interaction with the young people then and the discussions we had with young people’ (FEPS 2020, 65).
